title: ashleyknight
author: ashleyknight
content: I am wondering what are the ways to accept crypto payments in an online business. Should I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? Payments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history. What should I do?

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: You can add and use a crypto payment processor in your online store so that every payment will be accommodated in the wallet provided by the payment processor, this is what you can learn about crypto payment processors https://nowpayments.io/blog/crypto-payment-processor-explainedIf you want to accept crypto for your business then you must understand the volatilityof crypto  price.

comments.author: coinerer
comments.body: Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMI am wondering what are the ways to accept crypto payments in an online business. Should I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? Payments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history. What should I do? There are various payment gateway systems provided by various third-party sites for accepting payments through cryptocurrencies.  If you want to accept payments in cryptocurrency for your online business, you can set up payment gateways from third-party sites or if you've created a wordpress site, you can easily get some plugins to accept cryptocurrency payments that can be installed easily.  You can set the payment gateway.  By which a customer can easily pay you through cryptocurrency.  And you don't have to give your personal wallet to anyone.  A separate wallet will be generated for each customer. If you can't do it yourself.  Then you can hire a dev to do it easily

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMI am wondering what are the ways to accept crypto payments in an online business. Should I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? It's not troublesome, that's the traditional way to receive payments and there's no need to make things complicated. Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMPayments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history. What should I do? Nope, it's not going to happen. Each wallet address is unique and you can simply print the QR code for that wallet address so that your customers will just have to scan it for you.

comments.author: dwminer1
comments.body: Currently, the acceptance of cryptocurrency payments is not a technical problem. There are many payment processors. From my experience, I can recommend bitpay: https://bitpay.com/online-payments/I do not know what country you come from or what industry you operate in, but before you decide to accept crypto payments from your clients, I advise you to read the legal and tax topic in this regard. In many countries, this can cause more problems than benefits. Sad but true.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: QR code is very easy to use. if you are going to use crypto or Bitcoin as a means of payment in your business. you do print your QR code and show it to the cashier. of course, you can print some QR Code addresses to make transactions easier.what might make you a little difficult is updating the price of the product you market with crypto conversion as a means of payment. this is likely to require an additional application at the checkout to show the price to be paid using multiple methods.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMShould I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? Payments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history.That is possible, but won't be scalable. An address mistake is also part of that method, well, actually some cryptocurrencies business always deal with wrong addresses or networks within the payment system, mostly from the user part.Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMWhat should I do? Since you don't tell how you built or develop your online business, I'm gonna say that it is just the same as integrating a basic payment system using Stripe or Paypal, just try to find cryptocurrencies payment gateway services.But if you want a more elaborate answer, try to answer first about, how you build your app or platform? What kind of cryptocurrencies you are willing to accept, and did you want to retrieve it in a cryptocurrency or FIAT? And how do you want to store the payment? on third-party or on your own.

comments.body: Feel free to see on these list: https://github.com/alexk111/awesome-bitcoin-payment-processorsThere a lot service payment processor gateway on there with various option, anyway my best advice for your question is better to ask more detail to the service it self. comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on November 01, 2022, 07:29:58 PMFeel free to see on these list: https://github.com/alexk111/awesome-bitcoin-payment-processorsI think this was the curated list of payment processors and I would recommend OP to check this one if he want to experiment first, check if free is good compare to a paid service (of course if monetary budget is a question here). comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Don't directly use your own wallet to receive a payment from your clients since it will harm your privacy concern, you need to use Bitcoin payment processor as you can read it in this thread List Bitcoin Payment Processors. I will recommend to use BTCPay Server since it has a complete feature and remain the best processor until now, the disadvantages is you need to set up the processors first, but they've a full guide to install it.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: For beginners, I would recommend CapitalWallet, as I have accepted crypto payments for my business and have not faced any issues to date.and the reason I ended up choosing CapitalWallet was its low conversion fees, and it only charges 0.5% while other exchanges have a 1% minimum conversion fee. And also, I got my funds on time which is great.and it's just a recommendation that is not necessarily suitable for you and it all depends on your needs and comfort in using it.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMI am wondering what are the ways to accept crypto payments in an online business. Should I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? Payments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history. What should I do? You can take advantage of the experience of other online businesses that accept payments in cryptocurrencies. That is, see how it looks on their website, you can even test it with a purchase to understand how it works. But it would be better if you turn to professionals (for example, on freelance platforms) who have experience in such an implementation and use their help. This will save you resources than if you personally tried to figure out this problem and look for a solution for it.- Of course, you will need to provide your crypto-wallet address in order to receive payment. It will be better if this is a separate business address for working with clients.- There is nothing complicated with paying cryptocurrencies, this is a myth.- Payments can't be sent to the wrong address in any way, if the data is correct, this is also a myth. For your peace of mind, you can additionally use a QR code.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Just have a QR code for them so that they won't annoyed just to pay you. But before that, you need to be aware of certain Crypto QR codes maker that are scam. Instead of generating your crypto address, they generate their address and once you send some crypto to that code, obviously it will gonna sent to scammer address. So you better test multiple times to assure there will be no errors.

comments.author: jostorres
comments.body: Quote from: ashleyknight on November 01, 2022, 05:22:02 AMI am wondering what are the ways to accept crypto payments in an online business. Should I share my wallet address and ask clients to send payments to it? Isn't it troublesome? Payments could be sent to the wrong wallet address and also it would be difficult to manage the transaction history. What should I do? Yes, that's right. Many wallets now do have a QR code. You can also share it to them so that they will just scan it. That should avoid errors instead of copying the receiving address manually but they should make it a habit to double check the address that they see on their screens so that they are sure that the coins are sent to the right address because sometimes mistakes can still happen and we don't know what if our device have been infected by a malware, which automatically changes the address that is being pasted.Every wallet has an option to show your transaction history and it is not difficult to manage them if you are already familiar of how crypto works.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: The most easiest way would probably be a payment processor, just hire someone with the know hows of you don't know how to do it or if you're not confident of implementing it. The other way would be QR code, simple a f as well to setup, just post it at the counter.Additionally, You can even setup a way for receipt to process once payment is received or is being confirmed, or some other way that can make checking less of a hassle. You might need some IT help there though.

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: -    If that is your personal cryptocurrency wallet, my advice to you is that you should separate the wallet that you will use it for the business that you will do, so that there is no compromise in the future if it happens. Then it also depends on which country you are located in.If there is a mistake in the delivery address, of course there are only two things, either the person who will pay the address did not look carefully or you may have made a mistake, it's as simple as that, so check carefully before confirming that it is sent.

comments.author: cryptoknightt
comments.body: Payment errors when using a wallet are not your fault, bro.of course the sender is wrong, all businesses are like that and you need to know the transaction history is also transparent by cryptocurrency, even though when a wrong delivery occurs no one is responsiblebut you can apply the wallet address like a barcode to make it safer and more printable

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: A quick tip: Select the best payment processor you will use. As a developer, I already tried to work n some payment processors where you will integrate these 3rd party services to accept cryptocurrency payments to your business.There will be some 3rd party services that are really worst especially their documentation of API or how you integrate their service.Some are not well documented and some are really worst in devloper's point of view.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoknightt on March 24, 2023, 03:24:52 AMPayment errors when using a wallet are not your fault, bro.of course the sender is wrong, all businesses are like that and you need to know the transaction history is also transparent by cryptocurrency, even though when a wrong delivery occurs no one is responsiblebut you can apply the wallet address like a barcode to make it safer and more printableBarcode is safe as long as you're show it on your device, if you print the barcode it doesn't safe enough because someone can swap it with their own wallet barcode, no one will know if the barcode is legit or not except the cashier crosscheck with the wallet address.Transaction history is transparent in blockchain, not cryptocurrency. Cryptocurrency is just the currency, not a way to see the transaction history.
